quest.name: My First Saw
journal: Timbermaster Beatin is testing fledgling carpenters by challenging them to craft maple lumber.
As your first test, Timbermaster Beatin challenges you to demonstrate your knowledge of wood by crafting and delivering a length of maple lumber.

Having inspected your maple lumber, Timbermaster Beatin declares that you have passed the first test. He then instructs you to continue to hone your skills as a carpenter and return when you have gained more experience.

※The next carpenter quest will be available from Beatin upon reaching level 5.
objectives: Deliver a length of maple lumber to Beatin.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Good. You have proven that you know how to grip a saw. But do not mistake it for a mere tool, for it is a part of you─of your arm. And can you put down part of your arm? No.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Mark me, then: if you do put it down, and worse, lose the bloody thing, I shall use mine own saw to demonstrate to you the pain of losing a limb.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Ah, but I jest. One-armed carpenters are scarcely half as useful, in my experience.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: In any case, merely holding a saw does not make you a carpenter, whatever some might think. You must become one with it, and learn to feel with it as you work the wood.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: To wit, you must first know the wood. Demonstrate your knowledge by bringing me a length of maple lumber.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Maple lumber is made from maple logs, just so.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Our man Ferreol, by the entrance, will furnish you with such logs for a nominal price.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Of course, any fool knows that fresh-cut logs are laden with water.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: To guard against decay, we use wind shards to hasten the natural drying process.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Do not forget to do the same.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To synthesize a length of maple lumber for Timbermaster Beatin, select Logs from the main menu, followed by Crafting Log.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, Ferreol has maple logs in his stock, as well as many other materials you may require.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Or, if you are ready, show me what you have brought.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Yes...I feel it. The wood tells all.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: There were no careless cuts. Saw and carpenter moved as one, as if dancing.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Do you see this grain, how it flows softly, like syrup?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Durable yet pliant, suitable for weapons and armor both─this, child, is maple.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Trace the grain with your fingertips and memorize the lines. Consider every characteristic when choosing your materials.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: That is what it means to know the wood.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: The maple lumber you have brought me is...acceptable. You have passed the first test.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Yet for all it has grown, your knowledge is still lacking. You must needs learn more─a true carpenter knows the qualities and uses of every tree in the forest. When you know the lines of the maple better than those upon your own hand, return to me.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I shall have another test for you. Until then, child.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next carpenter quest will be available from Beatin upon reaching level 5.
